nl.strohalm.cyclos.access

Interface Permission

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AdminPermission
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdminAdminPermission, AdminMemberPermission, AdminSystemPermission, BasicPermission, BrokerPermission, MemberPermission, OperatorPermission

    public interface Permission
    Permissions can be of two types: LIST or BOOLEAN. A BOOLEAN permission represents the allowance of making or not an action. e.g: a permission to manage static documents. A LIST permission represents a collection of entities of the same type with which a group is allowed to work. This collection is associated to a group linked by the relationship() relationship. e.g: the collection of allowed static documents for a specific group of administrators. If the relationship() method returns null, the permission is of type BOOLEAN. Otherwise, the permission is of type LIST.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Module getModule() 
      java.lang.String getQualifiedName() 
      java.lang.String getValue() 
      java.lang.String name() 
      Relationship relationship()
      The relationship used to get the allowed values from a group for a permission of type list.

        A boolean permission will return null.
